meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: POKE EARLY AND POKE OFTEN

div.a: How Facebook Could Help Swing The Election

div.div: Could Facebook help swing this year's U.S. presidential election? That's the possibility raised by a study showing that a simple message on the social network could help boost turnout of Facebook users by 2.2 percent. With the right targeting of voters in marginal seats, that might be enough to swing an election.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q38Ndv&via=Digg&text=How Facebook Could Help Swing The Election

div.div: MEME HISTORY

div.a: Helpful Video Shows Where All Your Favorite Memes Originate From

div.div: Watching this video from hatinhand, who traced the origin of so many of your favorite memes, is like taking a trip down memeory (sorry) lane.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PoKWYB&via=Digg&text=Helpful Video Shows Where All Your Favorite Memes Originate From

div.div: TERRORISM
How does one major city test and prepare for the unthinkable?
GOOGLE
Google's glasses are escaping from the laboratory. But they aren't ready for the real world yet.
NOT JUST A VAMPIRE KILLER

div.a: Thomas Jefferson Defends America With A Moose

div.div: Europeans said America was “degenerate.” Jefferson was obsessed with proving them wrong.

li.div: This is why Thomas Jefferson would have loved blogging, even against "settled" science slate.com/articles/health_...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SaDRHN&via=Digg&text=Thomas Jefferson Defends America With A Moose

div.div: WAR GAMES

div.a: Why American Troops Love To Play A Game Featuring Orks, Necrons, And Space Marines

div.div: As an Army officer, Maj. Stephen D. Carey has served tours of duty in Iraq and Afghanistan. In his spare time, he fights a different kind of battle, one that rages in the apocalyptic 41st millennium.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TJcB9e&via=Digg&text=Why American Troops Love To Play A Game Featuring Orks, Necrons, And Space Marines

div.div: WAKE UP!

div.a: Why You Shouldn't Sleep Late This Weekend

div.div: Contrary to popular belief, sleeping in on the weekends does not help you catch up on sleep lost during the week.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NY4lBf&via=Digg&text=Why You Shouldn't Sleep Late This Weekend

div.div: NOBODY DOES

div.a: No, Rahm Emanuel Does Not Like Nickelback

div.div: A spokeswoman for Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel has confirmed that he doesn't actually like Nickelback, despite a sign at the teachers strike that indicated otherwise.

li.div: One thing teachers and the mayor agree on: Everybody hates Nickelback redeyechicago.com/news/red...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OEpPPb&via=Digg&text=No, Rahm Emanuel Does Not Like Nickelback

div.div: FLY RYANAIR

div.a: World's Most Lovable CEO Calls Customers 'Idiots'

div.div: Michael O'Leary has made outrageous statements before, musing about shooting environmentalists and adding in-flight porn to Ryanair flights. Now he's turning on his own passengers.
YUGE

div.a: Sports Radio Host Falls Asleep On Air

div.div: Has radio host Mike Francesa been staying up too late at night? It sure seems like it, since he actually fell asleep while he was on the air the other day.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RIGhm3&via=Digg&text=Sports Radio Host Falls Asleep On Air

div.div: PUNCH CARD MASS MURDER

div.a: Brad Pitt To Produce 'IBM And The Holocaust'

div.div: Pitt is developing a feature based on Edwin Black’s New York Times bestseller "IBM and the Holocaust," a 2001 book that examined the computer solutions giant’s indispensible role in facilitating the Third Reich’s extermination of European Jewry.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Oh7zdp&via=Digg&text=Brad Pitt To Produce 'IBM And The Holocaust'

div.div: PATRIOTIC PRINTED PLASTIC

div.a: Injured Bald Eagle Gets New 3D Printed Beak

div.div: Beauty the bald eagle was shot in the face by a poacher, damaging her beak quite badly. A team of specialists came up with the perfect solution: a 3D printed nylon polymer beak.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEViE8&via=Digg&text=Injured Bald Eagle Gets New 3D Printed Beak

div.div: TMI

div.a: McDonald's Adds Calorie Counts To Menu

div.div: Starting next week, McDonald's customers will know exactly how many calories are in their food.
ATTACK IN LIBYA

div.a: The Obscure Film That Sparked The Deadly Riots In Libya

div.div: The violence that claimed the life of Chris Stevens, the U.S. ambassador to Libya, and three of his American staff members yesterday appears to have been sparked by an obscure, anti-Islam film produced by Sam Bacile, an Israeli-American real-estate developer who says his goal was to draw attention to the hypocrisies of Islam.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Sc6wMH&via=Digg&text=The Obscure Film That Sparked The Deadly Riots In Libya

div.div: MARY: 'I TOLD YOU SO'

div.a: Virgin Births Seen In The Wild

div.div: New research has proven that species that usually reproduce sexually are capable of delivering offspring without mating.
SMELLS

div.a: Are Dead Fish Making Southern California Stink?

div.div: A putrid stench has been wafting over swaths of Southern California this week and while not yet confirmed, the leading theory blames the smell on a massive die-off of fish.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NZmrTk&via=Digg&text=Are Dead Fish Making Southern California Stink?

div.div: HAPPY HOURS HAVEN'T BEEN SO HAPPY

div.a: Alcohol Killing People More Quickly Than Usual

div.div: The Czech Republic has announced a state of emergency, saying that at least 15 people are dead and 24 have been hospitalized after drinking cheap vodka and rum laced with methanol.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OgCqH1&via=Digg&text=Alcohol Killing People More Quickly Than Usual

div.div: FUTURE OF GAMES

div.a: Microsoft Envisions Where Gaming Is Going, And It's Wild!

div.div: So where will Microsoft take gaming in the future?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RsefuW&via=Digg&text=Microsoft Envisions Where Gaming Is Going, And It's Wild!
